00033 DistanceMetric::~DistanceMetric() {

00035 
00036 double DistanceMetric::dist(const Matrix &M, int col1Ix, int col2Ix) const {
00037   Numeric dist = DotProduct(M.Column(col1Ix), M.Column(col2Ix));
00038   return dist;
00039 }
00040 
00041   /** 
00042    * Compute a distance metric between two columns of a
00043    * matrix. <b>Note that the indexes are *1* based (not 0) as that is
00044    * Newmat's convention</b>. Note that dist(M,i,j) must equal dist(M,j,i);
00045    * 
00046    * @param M - Matrix whose columns represent individual items to be clustered.
00047    * @param col1Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00048    * @param col2Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00049    * 
00050    * @return - "Distance" or "dissimilarity" metric between two columns of matrix.
00051    */
00052 double CorrelationMetric::dist(const Matrix &M, int col1Ix, int col2Ix) const {
00053     std::vector<double> c1(M.Nrows()), c2(M.Nrows());
00054     for(int i = 0; i < M.Nrows(); i++) {
00055       c1[i] = M.element(i,col1Ix-1);
00056       c2[i] = M.element(i,col2Ix-1);
00057     }
00058     double dist = 1 + correlation_coeff(c1.begin(), c1.end(), c2.begin());
00059     return dist;
00060   }
00061 
00062 GuassianRadial::GuassianRadial(double sigma) {
00063   m_Sigma = sigma;
00064 }
00065 
00066 /** 
00067  * Compute a distance metric between two columns of a
00068  * matrix. <b>Note that the indexes are *1* based (not 0) as that is
00069  * Newmat's convention</b>. Note that dist(M,i,j) must equal dist(M,j,i);
00070  * 
00071  * @param M - Matrix whose columns represent individual items to be clustered.
00072  * @param col1Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00073  * @param col2Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00074  * 
00075  * @return - "Distance" or "dissimilarity" metric between two columns of matrix.
00076  */
00077 double GuassianRadial::dist(const Matrix &M, int col1Ix, int col2Ix) const {
00078   double dist = 0;
00079   if(col1Ix == col2Ix) 
00080     return 0;
00081   ColumnVector V = M.Column(col1Ix) - M.Column(col2Ix);
00082   dist = V.SumSquare() / (2 * m_Sigma * m_Sigma);
00083   dist = exp(-1 * dist);
00084   return dist;
00085 }

00087 AngleMetric::AngleMetric(const Matrix &M) {
00088   setMatrix(M);
00089 }
00090 
00091 /** 
00092  * Set the matrix. This precalculates the norms for each column so
00093  * they are only calculated once.
00094  * @param M - Matrix to be used.
00095  */
00096 void AngleMetric::setMatrix(const Matrix &M) {
00097   m_Norms.resize(M.Ncols(),0);
00098   for(int i=1; i <= M.Ncols(); i++) {
00099     m_Norms[i-1] = sqrt(M.Column(i).SumSquare());
00100   }
00101 }
00102   
00103 ExpAngleMetric::ExpAngleMetric(const Matrix &M, double sigma) :  AngleMetric(M) {
00104   m_Sigma=sigma;
00105 }
00106   
00107 /** 
00108  * Compute a distance metric between two columns of a
00109  * matrix. <b>Note that the indexes are *1* based (not 0) as that is
00110  * Newmat's convention</b>. Note that dist(M,i,j) must equal dist(M,j,i);
00111  * 
00112  * In this case the distnance metric is the exponated 1 - cosine of the angle between the
00113  * two vectors, this is also sometimes known as the uncentered correlation coefficient
00114  * and is similar to correlation except that it requires the length of the vectors to 
00115  * be the same for cos(x,y) to be 1.
00116  * 
00117  * If x and y are vectors then:
00118  * \f$ ExpAngleDist(\vec{x},\vec{y}) = e^{-1 * (1 - cos(\theta))/2\sigma^2} \f$
00119  * Where:
00120  * \f$ cos(\theta) = \frac{ \vec{x}^t \cdot \vec{y}}{\|\vec{x}\|\|\vec{y}\|} \f$
00121  * Where the numerator is the dot product of <b>x</b> and <b>y</b>.
00122  * @param M - Matrix whose columns represent individual items to be clustered.
00123  * @param col1Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00124  * @param col2Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00125  * 
00126  * @return - "Distance" or "dissimilarity" metric between two columns of matrix.
00127  */
00128 double ExpAngleMetric::dist(const Matrix &M, int col1Ix, int col2Ix) const {
00129   double dist = 0;
00130   int nRow = M.Nrows();
00131   for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < nRow; rowIx++) {
00132     dist += M.element(rowIx,col1Ix-1) * M.element(rowIx, col2Ix -1);
00133   }
00134   dist /= (m_Norms[col1Ix-1] * m_Norms[col2Ix-1]);
00135   dist = exp(-1 * ((1 - dist)/(2*m_Sigma*m_Sigma)));
00136   return dist;
00137 }
00138 
00139 /** 
00140  * Compute a distance metric between two columns of a
00141  * matrix. <b>Note that the indexes are *1* based (not 0) as that is
00142  * Newmat's convention</b>. Note that dist(M,i,j) must equal dist(M,j,i);
00143  * 
00144  * In this case the distnance metric is the cosine of the angle between the
00145  * two vectors, this is also sometimes known as the uncentered correlation coefficient
00146  * and is similar to correlation except that it requires the length of the vectors to 
00147  * be the same for cos(x,y) to be 1.
00148  * 
00149  * If x and y are vectors then:
00150  * \f$ angleDist(\vec{x},\vec{y}) = cos(\theta) = \frac{ \vec{x}^t \cdot \vec{y}}{\|\vec{x}\|\|\vec{y}\|} \f$
00151  * Where the numerator is the dot product of <b>x</b> and <b>y</b>.
00152  * @param M - Matrix whose columns represent individual items to be clustered.
00153  * @param col1Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00154  * @param col2Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
00155  * 
00156  * @return - "Distance" or "dissimilarity" metric between two columns of matrix.
00157  */
00158 double AngleMetric::dist(const Matrix &M, int col1Ix, int col2Ix) const {
00159   double dist = 0;
00160   int nRow = M.Nrows();
00161   col1Ix--;
00162   col2Ix--;
00163   for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < nRow; rowIx++) {
00164     dist += M[rowIx][col1Ix] * M[rowIx][col2Ix];
00165   }
00166   dist = (dist / (m_Norms[col1Ix] * m_Norms[col2Ix]) + 1); // cosine is always between 1 and -1 this scales to 2 0.
00167   return dist;
00168 }
00169 
00170 void SpectClust::multByMatrix(ColumnVector &N, ColumnVector &O, const Matrix &M) {
00171   int nRow = M.Nrows(), nCol = M.Ncols();
00172   if(!(N.Nrows() == O.Nrows() && M.Nrows() == M.Ncols() && M.Nrows() == N.Nrows())) {
00173     Err::errAbort("wrong dimensions: " + ToStr(O.Nrows()) + " " + ToStr(N.Nrows()) + " " + ToStr(M.Nrows()));
00174   }
00175   for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < nRow; rowIx++) {
00176     N[rowIx] = 0;
00177     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < nCol; colIx++) {
00178       N[rowIx] += O[colIx] * M[rowIx][colIx];
00179     }
00180   }
00181 }
00182 
00183 double SpectClust::fast_corr(std::vector<double> &x, std::vector<double> &y) {
00184   assert(x.size() == y.size());
00185   int n = x.size();
00186   double xyS=0, xS=0, x2S=0, yS=0, y2S=0;
00187   for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00188     xyS += x[i] * y[i];
00189     xS += x[i];
00190     yS += y[i];
00191     x2S += x[i] * x[i];
00192     y2S += y[i] * y[i];
00193   }
00194   double invN = (double)1/n;
00195   double cor = (xyS - (invN * xS * yS))/(sqrt(x2S - (invN * xS * xS)) * sqrt(y2S - (invN * yS * yS)));
00196   return cor;
00197 }
00198 
00199 void SpectClust::fillInDistance(SymmetricMatrix &A, const Matrix &M, const DistanceMetric &dMetric, bool expon) {
00200   A.ReSize(M.Ncols());
00201   for(int i = 1; i <= M.Ncols(); i++) {
00202     for(int j = i; j <= M.Ncols(); j++) {
00203       if(expon) 
00204         A(j,i) = A(i,j) = exp(-1 * dMetric.dist(M,i,j));
00205       else
00206         A(j,i) = A(i,j) = dMetric.dist(M,i,j);
00207     }
00208   }
00209 }
00210 
00211 double SpectClust::rowMedian(const Matrix &M, int rowIx) {
00212   std::vector<double> r(M.Ncols(),0);
00213   for(int i = 0; i < M.Ncols(); i++) {
00214     r[i] = M.element(rowIx,i);
00215   }
00216   double med = median_in_place(r.begin(), r.end());
00217   return med;
00218 }
00219 
00220 void SpectClust::rowMedianDivide(Matrix &M) {
00221   for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < M.Nrows(); rowIx++) {
00222     double med = rowMedian(M, rowIx);
00223     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < M.Ncols(); colIx++) {
00224       M.element(rowIx,colIx) /= med;
00225     }
00226   }
00227 }
00228 
00229 void SpectClust::subColAvg(Matrix &M) {
00230   ColumnVector Ones(M.Nrows());
00231   Ones = 1.0;
00232   // Calculate the average for each column matrix style.
00233   Matrix ColAvg = Ones.t() * M;
00234   ColAvg = ColAvg / M.Nrows();
00235   // Make a matrix with row averages for each column and
00236   // subtract from original matrix M
00237   M = M - (Ones * ColAvg);
00238 }
00239 
00240 void SpectClust::MatrixScatter(Matrix &M, Matrix &C) {
00241   Matrix X(M);
00242   subColAvg(X); // subtract of mean of each column
00243   C = (X.t() * X); // expected value of (X - xmu)(Y - ymu)
00244 }
00245 
00246 void SpectClust::MatrixCov(Matrix &M, Matrix &C) {
00247   MatrixScatter(M,C);
00248   C = C / (M.Nrows() - 1); // expected value of (X - xmu)(Y - ymu)
00249 }
00250 
00251 void SpectClust::MatrixCor(Matrix &M, Matrix &C) {
00252   Matrix X(M);
00253   MatrixCov(M,C);
00254   DiagonalMatrix V(C.Nrows());
00255   V << C;
00256   for(int i = 0; i < V.Nrows(); i++) {
00257     V.element(i,i) = 1 / sqrt(V.element(i,i)); 
00258   }
00259   C = V * C * V;
00260 }
00261 
00262 bool SpectClust::MaxEigen(const Matrix &M, double &maxValue, ColumnVector &MaxVec, int maxIterations) {
00263   double maxDelta = 1e-6;
00264   bool converged = false;
00265   int i = 0;
00266   int nRows = M.Ncols();
00267   if(M.Ncols() != M.Nrows()) 
00268     Err::errAbort("MaxEigen() - Can't get eigen values of non square matrices.");
00269   if(M.Ncols() <= 0) 
00270     Err::errAbort("MaxEigen() - Must have positive number of rows and columns.");
00271   ColumnVector V(M.Ncols());
00272   V = 1.0 / M.Nrows(); // any vector really...
00273   V = V / Norm1(V);
00274   MaxVec.ReSize(M.Ncols());
00275   for(i = 0; i < maxIterations; ++i) {
00276     //    MaxVec = M * V;
00277     multByMatrix(MaxVec, V, M);
00278     double delta = 0;
00279     double norm = sqrt(SumSquare(MaxVec));
00280     for(int vIx = 0; vIx < nRows; vIx++) {
00281       MaxVec.element(vIx) = MaxVec.element(vIx) / norm; // scale so we don't get too big.
00282     }
00283     for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < nRows; rowIx++) {
00284       delta += fabs((double)MaxVec.element(rowIx) - V.element(rowIx));
00285     }
00286     if(delta < maxDelta)  
00287       break; // we've already converged to eigen vector.
00288     V = MaxVec;
00289   }
00290   if(i < maxIterations) {
00291     converged = true;
00292   }
00293   // calculate approximate max eigen value using Rayleigh quotient (x'*M*x/x'*x).
00294   Matrix num = (MaxVec.t() * M * MaxVec);
00295   Matrix denom =  (MaxVec.t() * MaxVec);
00296   maxValue = num.element(0,0) / denom.element(0,0);
00297   return converged;
00298 }
00299 
00300 void SpectClust::normalizeSum(SymmetricMatrix &A) {
00301   RowVector Ones(A.Ncols());
00302   Ones = 1.0;
00303   // Calculate the sum of each row matrix style. Could this be a Diagonal Matrix instead?
00304   Matrix RowSum = Ones * (A.t());
00305   DiagonalMatrix D(A.Ncols());
00306   D = 0;
00307   // Take the inverse square root
00308   for(int i = 1; i <= A.Ncols(); i++) {
00309     D(i,i) = 1/sqrt(RowSum(1,i));
00310   }
00311   Matrix X = D * (A * D);
00312   A << X;
00313 }
00314 
00315 bool SpectClust::findNLargestEvals(const Matrix &M, int numLamda, std::vector<Numeric> &eVals, Matrix &EVec, int maxIterations) {
00316   bool converged = true;
00317   EVec.ReSize(M.Ncols(), numLamda);
00318   eVals.clear();
00319   eVals.reserve(numLamda);
00320   Matrix W = M;
00321     
00322   for(int i = 1; i <= numLamda; i++) {
00323     ColumnVector maxVec;
00324     double maxVal;
00325     /* Get the maximum eigen vector. */
00326     converged = MaxEigen(W, maxVal, maxVec, maxIterations) && converged;
00327     EVec.Column(i) << maxVec;
00328     eVals.push_back(maxVal);
00329      
00330     /* Now subtract of the largest eigen value to get the next
00331        largest in next iteration. */
00332     Matrix ToSub = maxVal * (maxVec * maxVec.t());
00333     W = W - ToSub;
00334   }
00335   return converged;
00336 }
00337 
00338 double SpectClust::calcNormalizedCut(const Matrix &D, 
00339                                      const std::vector<std::pair<double,int> > &indices, 
00340                                      int cut) {
00341   double assocA = 0, assocB = 0, cutAB = 0;
00342   // count up weight of A nodes connected to B nodes. 
00343   for(int aIx = 0; aIx < cut; aIx++) {
00344     int Aindex = indices[aIx].second;
00345     for(int colIx = cut; colIx < indices.size(); colIx++) {
00346       int Bindex = indices[colIx].second;
00347       if(Aindex == Bindex) {
00348         Err::errAbort("How can " +ToStr(Aindex) + " be in both the a and b index?");
00349       }
00350       cutAB += D.element(Aindex,Bindex);
00351     }
00352   }
00353   // Count up connectivity of A to entire graph.
00354   for(int aIx = 0; aIx < cut; aIx++) {
00355     int Aindex = indices[aIx].second;
00356     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < D.Ncols(); colIx++) {
00357       assocA += D.element(Aindex, colIx);
00358     }
00359   }
00360   // Count up connectivity of B to entire graph.
00361   for(int bIx = cut; bIx < D.Nrows(); bIx++) {
00362     int Bindex = indices[bIx].second;
00363     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < D.Ncols(); colIx++) {
00364       assocB += D.element(Bindex, colIx);
00365     }
00366   }
00367   double nCut = DBL_MAX;
00368   if(assocA != 0 && cutAB != 0 && assocB != 0)
00369     nCut = (cutAB/assocA + cutAB/assocB);
00370   return nCut;
00371 }
00372 
00373 
00374 void SpectClust::calcNormalizedCutValues(const Matrix &D, const std::vector<std::pair<double,int> > &indices, 
00375                                          std::vector<double> &cutVals) {
00376   cutVals.resize(indices.size());
00377   std::fill(cutVals.begin(), cutVals.end(), DBL_MAX);
00378   double assocA = 0;
00379   double assocB = D.Sum();
00380   double currentNCut = 0;
00381   double lastNCut = 0;
00382   int nCol = D.Ncols();
00383   for(int cut = 0; cut < indices.size() -1; cut++) {
00384     double rowSum = 0;
00385     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < nCol; colIx++) {
00386       rowSum += D.element(indices[cut].second, colIx);
00387     }
00388     assocA += rowSum;
00389     assocB -= rowSum;
00390     double cutChange = 0;
00391     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < cut; colIx++) {
00392       cutChange -= D.element(indices[colIx].second, indices[cut].second);
00393     }
00394     for(int colIx = cut+1; colIx < nCol; colIx++) {
00395       cutChange += D.element(indices[cut].second, indices[colIx].second);
00396     }
00397     currentNCut = lastNCut + cutChange;
00398     if(assocA == 0 || assocB == 0 || currentNCut == 0) {
00399       cutVals[cut] = DBL_MAX;
00400     }
00401     else {
00402       double nVal = (currentNCut / assocA) + (currentNCut / assocB);
00403       cutVals[cut+1] = nVal; // +1 is to be compatible with existing calcNormalizedCut() conventions
00404     }
00405     lastNCut = currentNCut;
00406   }
00407 }
00408 
00409 
00410 bool SpectClust::findNLargestSymEvals(const SymmetricMatrix &W, int numLamda, std::vector<Numeric> &eVals, Matrix &EVec) {
00411   bool converged = false;
00412   eVals.clear();
00413   eVals.reserve(numLamda);
00414   DiagonalMatrix D(W.Ncols());
00415   Matrix E;
00416   try {
00417     EigenValues(W, D, E);
00418     converged = true;
00419     EVec.ReSize(W.Ncols(), numLamda);
00420     int count = 0;
00421     for(int i = W.Ncols(); i > W.Ncols() - numLamda; i--) {
00422       eVals.push_back(D(i));
00423       EVec.Column(++count) << E.Column(i);
00424     }
00425   }
00426   catch(const Exception &e) {
00427     Err::errAbort("Exception: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00428   }
00429   catch(...) {
00430     Err::errAbort("Yikes couldn't calculate eigen vectors.");
00431   }
00432   return converged;
00433 }
00434 
00435 void SpectClust::orderIntraClusterCorr(const Matrix &M, vector<int> &clusters, int numClusters, std::vector<double> &clusterCorr) {
00436   std::vector<std::pair<double,int> > inCorr;
00437   for(int clustIx = 0; clustIx < numClusters; clustIx++) {
00438     vector<double> clustCorr;
00439     for(int col1 = 0; col1 < M.Ncols(); col1++) {
00440       if(clusters[col1] == clustIx) {
00441         vector<double> c1Dat;
00442         vector<double> c2Dat;
00443         colToVector(M, col1, c1Dat);
00444         for(int col2 = col1 + 1; col2 < M.Ncols(); col2++) {
00445           if(clusters[col2] == clustIx) {
00446             colToVector(M, col2, c2Dat);
00447             double corr = fast_corr(c1Dat,c2Dat);
00448             clustCorr.push_back(corr);
00449           } // if
00450         } // for col2
00451       } // if clusters[col1]
00452     } // for col1
00453     std::pair<double,int> p;
00454     if(clustCorr.size() != 0) 
00455       p.first = median_in_place(clustCorr.begin(), clustCorr.end());
00456     else 
00457       p.first = -2; // lower than any possible correlation
00458     p.second = clustIx;
00459     inCorr.push_back(p);
00460   } // for clustIx
00461   std::sort(inCorr.begin(), inCorr.end(), PairLess());
00462   clusterCorr.resize(inCorr.size());
00463   for(int i = 0; i < inCorr.size(); i++) {
00464     clusterCorr[i] = inCorr[i].first;
00465   }
00466   vector<int> newClusters(clusters.size(), -1);
00467   for(int icIx = 0; icIx < inCorr.size(); icIx++) {
00468     for(int clustIx = 0; clustIx < clusters.size(); clustIx++) {
00469       if(clusters[clustIx] == inCorr[icIx].second) {
00470         newClusters[clustIx] = icIx;
00471       }
00472     }
00473   }
00474   clusters = newClusters;
00475 }
00476 
00477 void SpectClust::colToVector(const Matrix &M, int colIx , std::vector<double> &v) {
00478   v.clear();
00479   v.reserve(M.Nrows());
00480   for(int i =0; i < M.Nrows(); i++) {
00481     v.push_back(M.element(i,colIx));
00482   }
00483 }
00484 
00485 void SpectClust::partitionClusters(const Matrix &D, const Matrix &E, std::vector<Numeric> &eVals, int numClusters,
00486                                    std::vector<int> &clusters, int hardMin, double cutVal, double margin) {
00487   clusters.clear();
00488   clusters.resize(D.Ncols(), -1);
00489   std::vector<std::pair<double,int> > indices;
00490   /* Load up all the values and their indexes. */
00491   for(int i = 0; i < D.Ncols(); i++) {
00492     std::pair<double,int> p;
00493     p.first = E.element(i,1);
00494     p.second = i;
00495     indices.push_back(p);
00496   }
00497   std::sort(indices.begin(), indices.end(), PairLess());
00498   vector<double> indexNVals;
00499   calcNormalizedCutValues(D, indices, indexNVals);
00500   double minNormCut = DBL_MAX;
00501   int minNCutIx = 0;
00502   if(cutVal == DBL_MAX) {
00503     for(int i = 0; i < indexNVals.size(); i++) {
00504       double nCutI = indexNVals[i];
00505       if(nCutI < minNormCut) {
00506         minNCutIx = i;
00507         minNormCut = nCutI;
00508       }
00509     }
00510     cutVal = minNormCut;
00511   }
00512   else {
00513     for(int i = 0; i < indices.size() - 1; i++) {
00514       if(indices[i].first <= cutVal && indices[i+1].first >= cutVal) {
00515         minNCutIx = i;
00516       }
00517     }
00518   }
00519   clusters.resize(indices.size());
00520   fill(clusters.begin(), clusters.end(), -1);
00521   int maxNCutIx = minNCutIx;
00522   int diff = indices.size() - minNCutIx;
00523   diff = (int) (margin*diff);
00524   maxNCutIx = Max((int)indices.size() - diff, maxNCutIx); 
00525   if(minNCutIx >= hardMin)
00526     minNCutIx = Max((int)(margin*minNCutIx), hardMin);
00527   for(int i = 0; i < indices.size(); i++) {
00528     if(i <= minNCutIx) {
00529       clusters[indices[i].second] = 0;
00530     }
00531     else if(i > maxNCutIx) {
00532       clusters[indices[i].second] = 1;
00533     }
00534   }
00535 }
00536 
00537 void SpectClust::AICcRmaMedianCluster(const Matrix &PM, int numClusters, const std::vector<int> &clusters, 
00538                                    std::vector<double> &AICc, std::vector<double> &BIC, bool doLog) {
00539   vector<vector<vector<float> > > clusterDat(numClusters); // first index is cluster, then probe, then chip.
00540   vector<vector<float> > allDat;
00541   AICc.resize(2);
00542   fill(AICc.begin(), AICc.end(), 0);
00543   BIC.resize(2);
00544   fill(BIC.begin(), BIC.end(), 0);
00545   vector<int> clusterCounts(numClusters, 0);
00546   int okCount = 0;
00547   if(PM.Nrows() != clusters.size()) 
00548     Err::errAbort("SpectClust::AICcRmaMedianCluster() - Number of PM rows doesn't equal cluster vector size.");
00549   // setup PM matrices for each cluster and one for all the data.
00550   for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < clusters.size(); probeIx++) {
00551     if(clusters[probeIx] >= 0) {
00552       clusterCounts[clusters[probeIx]]++;
00553       okCount++;
00554       vector<float> dat(PM.Ncols());
00555       for(int chipIx = 0; chipIx < PM.Ncols(); chipIx++) {
00556         dat[chipIx] = PM.element(probeIx, chipIx);
00557       }
00558       clusterDat[clusters[probeIx]].push_back(dat);
00559       allDat.push_back(dat);
00560     }
00561   }
00562   if(okCount == 0) 
00563     Err::errAbort("SpectClust::AICcRmaMedianCluster() - No data provided.");
00564   // calculate the residual sum of square error from an RMA median polish fit over the clusters.
00565   double clustSumSquare = 0;
00566   vector<float> colEst;
00567   vector<float> rowEst;
00568   for(int clustIx = 0; clustIx < numClusters; clustIx++) {
00569     if(clusterCounts[clustIx] == 0) // no residuals if this cluster is empty.
00570       continue;
00571     RMA::medianPolishPsetFromMatrix(clusterDat[clustIx], clusterDat[clustIx].size(), clusterDat[clustIx][0].size(), colEst, rowEst, doLog);
00572     for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < clusterDat[clustIx].size(); rowIx++) {
00573       for(int colIx = 0; colIx < clusterDat[clustIx][0].size(); colIx++) {
00574         clustSumSquare += clusterDat[clustIx][rowIx][colIx] * clusterDat[clustIx][rowIx][colIx];
00575       }
00576     }
00577   }
00578   double allSumSquare = 0;
00579   // calculate residual sum of square error from an RMA median polish over entire data set.
00580   RMA::medianPolishPsetFromMatrix(allDat, allDat.size(), allDat[0].size(), colEst, rowEst, doLog);
00581   for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < allDat.size(); rowIx++) {
00582     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < allDat[0].size(); colIx++) {
00583       allSumSquare += allDat[rowIx][colIx] * allDat[rowIx][colIx];
00584     }
00585   }
00586   /* Number of parameters for each model. 
00587 
00588      For the single cluster model we have (NumProbes - 1) parameters
00589      for the probe effects (as median of probe effects is constrained
00590      to be zero) and additional NumChip parameters for the chip effects:
00591      Total = NumProbes - 1 + NumChips.
00592 
00593      For the two cluster model we have NumProbes_A - 1 for the first cluster
00594      probe effects and NumProbes_B -1 for the second cluster probe effects and additional
00595      NumChip parameters for the chip effects for both the A and B clusters:
00596      Total = NumProbes_A - 1 + NumProbes_B - 1 + (2 * NumChips) = NumProbes - 2 + (2 * NumChips)
00597   */
00598   int numParam = PM.Ncols() + okCount - 1;
00599   int clustNumParam = (PM.Ncols() * numClusters) + okCount - numClusters;
00600   int N = PM.Ncols() * okCount;
00601   if(okCount > numClusters+2) {
00602     double Izero = log(allSumSquare/N); 
00603     double Ione = log(clustSumSquare/N);
00604     double Uzero, Uone;
00605     Uzero = log(allSumSquare/(N -  numParam)); 
00606     Uone = log(clustSumSquare/(N - (clustNumParam)));
00607     AICc[0] = Izero + ((double)(N + numParam)/(N - numParam - 2));
00608     AICc[1] = Ione + ((N + (clustNumParam))/(double)(N - (clustNumParam) - 2));
00609     BIC[0] =  N * Izero + (numParam * log((double)N));
00610     BIC[1] =  N * Ione + (clustNumParam * log((double)N));
00611   }
00612 }
Generated on Tue Jul 15 2014 10:37:20 for Affymetrix Power Tools by  1.7.1
